messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:57): (some validator.nu virtual host are going down for maintenance. the validator functionality should be up on another server)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:05): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: what should happen if we parse an element or attribute name with a colon in it? (notwithstanding xlink: and xml: prefixes)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: in the Infoset coercing mode? it should trigger name munging
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:07): since it's not an XML 1.0 4th ed. plus Namespaces 2nd ed. NCName
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:07): <foo:bar> would be a well-formed NCName
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:07): foo: just wouldn't be bound
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:07): which is a separate problem
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:07): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it would be a Name but not an NCName
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:08): oh i see what you mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:08): but then what about the attributes that _do_ have colons?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:09): the name that is interesting is the local name after the possible XLink adjustments
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:10): so xlink:href on an HTML element would get munged but on a foreign element it wouldn't
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): aah, yes, defining in terms of local name, that's the key
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): ok
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:11): thanks
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: btw, contrary to previous note about UTF-8, I now do the name munging as hex UTF-16 code units
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:19): (because the UTF-8 conversion wasn't portable to GWT)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:20): i'm speccing the name munging to just be "replace the bad character with 'U' followed by the five character codepoint", as in '.foo' -> 'U0002Efoo'
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:20): I suppose UTF-16 to UTF-32 conversion is doable, but not too useful
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:21): well it doesn't really matter unless you're providing a library anyway
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:21): and are any astral characters that UTF-16 can express disallowed in NCNames?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:22): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: off the top of my head, no.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:24): actually i can't find where 4th ed allows astral characters at all
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: umm. right. top of my head was wrong
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:26): could have sworn it allowed them
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: it's the char production that allows everything above the BMP
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:27): sigh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:27): i hate arbitrary restrictions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:28): the restrictions on XML names are particularly silly considering perf
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:31): but don't forget, xml is faster!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:31): because it has no error handling code!
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (11:32): and no errors
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:35): i've revamped the coercions
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: looks good except I'd prefer permitting no-namespace attributes called "xmlns" or starting with "xmlns:" to be dropped.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:39): ok
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (11:40): (particularly this avoids munged attributes in docs that have conforming xmlns talismans)
